formalpara.title: Figure 2. Mitogen-activated protein kinase (MAPK) pathways in C. elegans innate immunity.
formalpara.para: Evolutionarily conserved MAPK signaling pathways regulate innate immune responses to microbial pathogen infection in C. elegans. Three simplified examples of well-characterized signaling cascades that act in (A) the intestine, (B) rectal epithelium, and (C) epidermis. Alternative representations for A and C can be found at http://www.wikipathways.org/index.php/Pathway:WP2923 and http://www.wikipathways.org/index.php/Pathway:WP2233, respectively.
